title: Kon Tum
text:
Kon Tum is the capital city of Kon Tum Province in <a href="Vietnam">Vietnam</a>. It is located inland in the <a href="Central%20Highlands%20%28Vietnam%29">Central Highlands</a> region of Vietnam, near the borders of <a href="Laos">Laos</a> and <a href="Cambodia">Cambodia</a>
History.
After the <a href="Vietnam%20People%27s%20Army">People's Army of Vietnam</a> invaded <a href="South%20Vietnam">South Vietnam</a> on March 30, 1972 during the <a href="Easter%20Offensive">Easter Offensive</a>, two divisions <a href="Battle%20of%20Kontum">attempted to capture</a> Kon Tum, but failed. In March 1975, however, Kon Tum was overrun during the <a href="Ho%20Chi%20Minh%20Campaign">Ho Chi Minh Campaign</a> and large numbers of refugees were forced to flee east to the south central coast.
Kon Tum has several vestiges of the French colonial period, as well as several tribal villages directly in the suburbs of the Vietnamese-reconstructed town. Among the town's landmarks, there is a <a href="Roman%20Catholic">Roman Catholic</a> <a href="wood">wood</a>en <a href="church%20%28building%29">church</a> on discrete stilts and a large French-built seminary which hosts a small museum on <a href="Montagnard%20%28Vietnam%29">local hill tribes</a>. French <a href="missionary">missionary</a> presence in Kon Tum traces back to 1851.
Climate.
Kon Tum has a <a href="tropical%20savanna%20climate">tropical savanna climate</a> (<a href="K%C3%B6ppen%20climate%20classification">Köppen</a> "Aw") with a wet season from April to November, a dry season from November to April, and consistently very warm to hot temperatures with high to oppressive humidity year-round.
